text: one more question  which CC have one of the better FX?
Credit cards have fairly similar fx (3.25% + underlying card provider rate)  except for trust credit card (which is very close to Google rate)
btw u should be looking at the rewards/cashback less the fx fees/markup  not just fx fees/markup only.
Any recommendation?Iâ€™m recently closed my evol card and swap it into uob 1 cc - trying â€œtrainâ€ a saving habit with uob one.Not sure what to do after I spend the 500 on my uob1 cc.

Trust card if STRICTLY going by fx rate (0%). This is the way if you are strictly into cost minimisation in your fx spending. As others have said  if you want cc rewards on top  Amaze with a suitable mastercard is your magic bullet
Saw many recommended citi rewards with amaze. Is this one of the best way moving forwards?
one of the best for S$1k foreign spend in statement month  except for travel/transport and other common exclusions
the best is subjective. It's the simplest strategy for day to day spend.

Not necessarily. Some other Mastercards (UOB Lady's and OCBC Rewards) can earn superior mileage (6mpd) provided the right conditions are met. Also  Citi Rewards blacklists travel purchases so you have to bear that in mind
Hi! For KK hospital which card would be the best?
All hospitals now only left amex tru cashback unless u r a mile person then wait for someone else to give advice
How about the UOB absolute Cashback? Is it possible?
Does Citi rewards or HSBC revolution cards receive bonus points for gym membership?
can pay on health buddy app  counted as online with mcc 8099  use dbs wwmc/citi rewards for 4mpd or citi smrt for 5% etc
My own experience I got HSBC Revo pts for AF and ClassPass monthly fee.

Hi gurus.1. For the EGA $2k in and 5 x $1 out transactions  just do normal transfer will do?2. Need any special remarks or transaction type?( like salary?)3. The in and out can just do between hsbc ega and a 2nd outside bank account? No need 3rd bank account right?
HSBC works for Fitness First's recurring payment.
hi  my scb journey visa card gave me points (1.2mpd) for my Mount A hosp bill and SGH bill  works for both public and private hospitals.

Hi all just got my first credit card and need some clarification. There are 2 dates on my statement:Statement date: 19th JunePayment due date: 15th JulyIs payment due date the last date I can pay for this particular statement cycle? And does the rewards systems resets at every statement date for a new cycle?

yes correct but depending on some banks take a few working days to process payment  best u pay 1 week before the payment due datesome bank reward system follow statement date  some banks follow month cycle  not same

yes due date is the last date that the bank receive payment without incurring late fee/interest  note that it may take a couple of days for payment to reach bank depending how u pay.Rewards system may follow statement month or calendar month depending which card
Hi all  usually when do u all receive the money from t-bills back..? Mine matures today n i used cpf oa to buy. Thank u.

Hi Gurus  may I ask if we manually do a partial payment say around 1 week before the credit card scheduled deduction date of our SP utilities bill  will SP be smart enough and just charge the balance?
It might sound weird that i am asking this. Reason being that the bill due date is last day of month  and it could end up being charged on the next month instead.ğŸ˜±
Understand that DBS WC miles is pay out blocks of $5. If I spent $4.90 = 0 DBS points?
It goes back to the holding account  for eg UOB kayhian. Stays there for 2 months unless u use it to buy tbill or retrieve it out
O base  but earns 4.9Ã·5Ã—9 = 8 DBS points bonus.
Hey Chris  can do an updated video for best credit cards to use for hotel wedding banquets? Need your hear your strategy ğŸ™ğŸ¼

If I may just give a quick inputFirst up  find the MCC of the terminal you are paying to. Hotel or Restaurant MCC? What other modes of payment the Banquet Manager accepts? Allows you to split payment?Then apply the relevant cards x 2 humans (husband and wife  or if family can help out even better).Then pay the banquet with the optimal cards on monthly basis.

and of course.. always ask this..Any discount IF YOU PAY CASH?to put it another way... if the banquet can be paid with cash and u get a 10% discount.. it might be better off paying cash compared to using credit cards
Sure  planning to do a series on all the big ticket adulting items
For the average mid-income Singaporean - is this credit card strategy for a hotel wedding banquet still the best/still relevant? Or have any become nerf-ed?

Still viable provided the hotel doesn't markup the fee by the credit card transaction fee...most important as said is find out the MCC used by the hotel / payment methods  then u can plan which cards to apply for / sign up bonuses
